title: U.K. Government Plays Down Brexit as Queen Reopens Parliament
text:
LONDON—A crucial week for Brexit began Monday with Queen Elizabeth II presenting Prime Minister Boris Johnson’s vision for Britain outside the European Union during a pomp-filled ceremony to reopen parliament.

During a speech to a room full of ermine-robed Lords, Brexit was mentioned only in passing by the Queen as the Conservative Party looked to present a heavily domestic agenda, focused on greater spending on policing and health care, to showcase what would happen if the U.K. leaves the EU on Oct. 31.
